lead_paragraph: RULLMAN--Edwards F.,94, passed away peacefully on Wednesday, February 3, 2016. A long-time resident of Brooklyn Heights and South Wellfleet, MA, he spent the last three years in residence at Broad Reach in Chatham, MA. Born in Red Bank, NJ on October 10, 1921 to Margaret E. Rullman and Dr. Walter A. Rullman, he served in the U.S. Army Signal Corp during World War II, and after the War in occupied Vienna, attaining the rank of 1st Lieutenant. He received his degree from the Yale School of Architecture in 1955. Much of his work specialized in restorations in New York City's historic districts. He was instrumental in the movement to establish Landmark Designation for Brooklyn Heights in 1965. He was predeceased by his wife, Josephine Francesca (Consoli) Rullman, in 2012. He is survived by his two daughters, Claudia E. Rullman and Martha A. Rullman, and a son-in-law, John J. Schuster. In lieu of flowers, donations may be sent to the Wellfleet Conservation Trust, the Mystic Seaport Museum, or the Cape Cod Chamber Music Festival. For online condolences, please visit: www.nickersonfunerals.com. 1/3
